description:
My first attempt at a two panel Mosaic with the SV70T.
I chose Eta Carina as it's a nice big, bright target to attempt as a test over two nights.
2 hrs each of 15 min subs Ha O3 & S2, 3nm Astrodon filters, with RGB stars.
There is a register problem with the stars at 9 o'clock, not sure exactly what happened there yet!
I've done a basic DDP stretch on the stacks, and aligned them using MSICE, which I found to be better than photomerge in PS2017. But obviously, there's still some issues to resolve.
Happy to take direction and input on this, but I don't use pixinsight, and prefer mac based solutions. That being said, I used Bootcamp to generate the stitches in MSICE for this one.
Then the usual HST, Bob Franke colour palatte, Andyfied with NIK filters etc.
I'm not 100% happy with the framing on this yet, IMO it needs rotatng about 30-45 degrees, so I'll likely redo it and try to get it looking really nice, so be kind with your comments folks!
Taken from suburban Melbourne, Australia, Pop 4.5million people with an excessive light fetish.
title: NGC 3372- Eta Carina Nebula in Narrowband
